thread.title: Ordnance Survey prize draw: terms and conditions
thread.title_full: Ordnance Survey prize draw: terms and conditions - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Ordnance Survey prize draw: terms and conditions
text: 1. This prize draw is open to residents of the UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and Republic of Ireland aged 18 years or over, except employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and its group companies (“Promoter”), and Ordnance Survey (OS) Limited, their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. Entries must be submitted via www.telegraph.co.uk/os from 14 August 2015 and entry is restricted to one per person. Once submitted, entries cannot be amended in any way. The first 10 eligible entries will be drawn at random within 7 days from the closing date. 4. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. The winners will be drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date. The winners’ names and counties can be obtained by sending a sae to Ordnance Survey Winners, SPARK, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London, SW1W 0DT within one month after the closing date of the prize draw. 5. All entries must be received by midnight on 30 September 2015. 6. The ten winners will be contacted by the Promoter by telephone within 14 days of the closing date of the prize draw. Should the Promoter be unable to contact the winner or should the winner be unable to accept the prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award the prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. 7. The prizes as described are available on the date of publication. Should the prize become unavailable, a substitute of equal value will be provided. 8. Ten winning entrants will each win the following: • A Navigational Bundle , including; - a Silva Carry Dry Map Case in a size large - a Silva Starter 8 Compass. • An OS Custom Made Map (a bespoke map centred on your chosen location). - To claim the Custom Made Map, OS will provide each winning entrant with a redeemable code to redeem the prize which must be activated within three months - Winners will be able to select between the OS Explorer (1:25,000) Map or OS Landranger (1:50,000) Map. • A 12-month subscription to OS Maps - To claim the OS Maps Service, OS will provide each winning entrant with a separate redeemable code which must be activated within three months.. 9. The prize must be taken as one package. 10. The items in the navigation bundle will be delivered free within 28 days, from the date the prize is claimed to any UK address specified by each winner. 11. All prizes are subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 12. The winners may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of OS and the Promoter. 13. Entrants’ data will be used for the purpose of administration of this prize draw and in accordance with the permissions granted or withheld at the point of entry. 14. All entrants who have submitted complete forms will receive a code that entitles them to one month’s free subscription to OS Maps. OS Maps is a digital mapping and route planning application offered by Ordnance Survey Leisure Limited, which provides access to national coverage of 1:25K (Explorer) and 1:50K (Landranger) mapping. The code will be sent to winning entrants after the draw closes. To redeem the code, winning entrants will need to visit the OS Maps Online Shop at www.ordnancesurvey.co.uk/shop/os-maps-online.html . Winners can then select the ‘OS Maps one month subscription’. At the Checkout, winners will be able to enter the code that has been given under the ‘Basket Summary page’. In order to use the service winners will need to register winners have not already done so. The 12 months’ free subscription period to OS Maps will start from the date that the code is activated. Entrants have up to 30 November 2015 to activate the code. The code can only be used once by each entrant. The code is not valid with any other promotional offer. 15. Use of the OS Maps service is subject to Terms & Conditions. These can be found at www.ordnancesurvey.co.uk/legal/ 16. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prizes impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter. Accordingly the Promoter may, at its absolute discretion, vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. 17. The Telegraph is responsible for the first part of the promotion, which is the publication and adjudication of the prize draw. Provision of the prize is the responsibility of the Ordnance Survey Limited. 18. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT.
